criteria.name: Scenario Quality (SC)
criteria.description: Is the problem scenario realistic, contextually rich, and helpful for you to transfer project knowledge to a relevant design decision?

criteria.name: Alignment (AL)
criteria.description: Does the problem align with the project learning objectives without introducing unrelated skills or omitting core learning objectives?

criteria.name: Cognitive Complexity (CC)
criteria.description: Does the problem engage you in higher-order thinking (analyzing, evaluating, and designing) rather than only recalling facts?

criteria.name: Clarity & Specificity (CS)
criteria.description: Is the problem clearly stated, self-contained, and free of ambiguities that could confuse or mislead you?

criteria.name: Feasibility (FS)
criteria.description: Is the problem appropriately scoped and solvable within 15-30 minutes given your expected prior project knowledge?
